alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown; Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 8:28PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Georgetown and southeastern Williamsburg Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 828 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jamestown, or 13 miles northeast of Moncks Corner, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Andrews, Rhems, Trio, Warsaw, Oatland, Nesmith, Indiantown, Lambert, Sampit, Graves, Earle, Morrisville and Henry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
